metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday and Psalm 130: The Depth of Sin and the Radiance of Grace

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems humanity from a state of total self-destruction and 'primordial catastrophe' through the Trinitarian blessing and the power of forgiveness.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop
The God who pursues us even beyond the grave
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

object.identificatie: Redemption and Restoration of the 'Miserable Offender'

zender.identificatie: The Triune God (as the source of Love and Mercy)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Miserable Offender' / The Church / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: the church that was breaking his heart is the one that gets the full Trinitarian blessing
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly positioned as the Receiver (the one in the 'depths').

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Incarnation/Blood) and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son
the love that has become incarnate in history through Jesus Christ
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' and the power that 'pours forth'.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a 'Vast Primordial Catastrophe' and Human Resistance
tekstueel_bewijs: depths of human pride, disobedience, perversity, and self-will
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as a 'catastrophe' and 'estrangement' that renders the human Subject totally unable to stand.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Human beings reflecting God's love through sacrificial care for others (parents, teachers, etc.).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Human Caretaker (Parent/Aunt/Teacher)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Human love is a 'glimmer' or 'hint' that points toward the primary program of God's love.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave
voorbeelden_mens_subject: the psalmist ceases to reflect upon himself
you would spend huge amounts of money

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
you would do anything, anything at all
the discovery that he is a God of infinite mercy
total inability to present ourselves righteous
the God who can redeem humanity

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human *non-pouvoir* (inability) and God's absolute *pouvoir* (sovereign power to save).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (The Depths) to ~S1 (Rejecting merit) to S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'fear of the Lord' which is a response to the majesty of S1 overcoming S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a 'primordial catastrophe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of salvation and defines the human condition as one of total inability, requiring an external rescue.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the parent analogy
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Imagine for a moment that you are the parent...

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human figures (parents/Paul) are used as analogies for God's character, not as models for the hearer to emulate to earn salvation.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Paul (as a mirror of God's agony, not a moral hero)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Paul's love is a 'hint' of God's love.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'depths' of the Law/Sin to the 'heights' of Trinitarian Grace is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'fear' and 'forgiveness' is masterfully resolved.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son... to redeem his entire creation.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'fellowship' and 'power' that humans lack.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is 'estrangement' and 'catastrophe' that humans cannot fix.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is purely theocentric. God is the Subject of the rescue; the human is the object of mercy.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace-oriented distribution.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a textbook example of the 'Grammar of Grace.' It avoids moralism by making God the primary actor and defining the human condition as one of total need.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the parent-child pathos, semiotics reveals that the parent is merely a functional 'Helper' actant pointing to the 'Subject' (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegese explains the Trinitarian formula; semiotics shows how that formula functions as a 'Sender' of value to a broken 'Receiver'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model exposes that even when the preacher says 'you would do anything,' the hearer is ultimately moved to the role of the 'Receiver' of God's 'anything'.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Fleming Rutledge's own principles (as she is the likely author), demonstrating a high degree of structural integrity.
